intro: Koanophyllon gibbosum, commonly known as the woollyleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a basal rosette of fuzzy, woolly leaves that are typically gray-green in color. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the spring, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Koanophyllon gibbosum is adapted to arid environments and thrives in rocky or sandy soils.
